intro: Antillanthus pachylepis, commonly known as the West Indian starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
